yu.einstein.gdp2.core.list.nucleotideList
Class TwoBitSequence

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<Nucleotide>
          yu.einstein.gdp2.core.list.nucleotideList.TwoBitSequence
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<Nucleotide>, java.util.Collection<Nucleotide>, java.util.List<Nucleotide>
public class TwoBitSequence
extends java.util.AbstractList<Nucleotide>
implements java.io.Serializable, java.util.List<Nucleotide>

This class provides the representation of a sequence from a .2bit file as described in the help file of the UCSC Genome Browser: http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat.html#format7

Version:
0.1
Author:
Julien Lajugie
See Also:

Creates an instance of TwoBitSequence

Parameters:
raf - RandomAccessFile
offset - offset of the sequence in the file
name - name of the sequence
reverseBytes - true if the byte order in the input file need to be reversed
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readResolve

private java.lang.Object readResolve()
                              throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
Methods used for the unserialization of the object. Since the random access file can't be serialized we try to recreate it if the file path is still the same See javadocs for more information

Returns:
the unserialized object
Throws:
